ocr_markdown:
# SAT Question Extract ## Question 20 The table summarizes the distribution of age and assigned group for 90 participants in a study.
0–9 years 10–19 years 20+ years Total
Group A 15 11 4 30
Group B 4 5 21 30
Group C 11 14 5 30
Total 30 30 30 90
One of these participants will be selected at random. What is the probability of selecting a participant from group A, given that the participant is at least 10 years of age? ## Options A) \( \frac{1}{6} \) B) \( \frac{1}{4} \) C) \( \frac{11}{30} \) D) \( \frac{1}{2} \)

questions.question_text: One of these participants will be selected at random. What is the probability of selecting a participant from group A, given that the participant is at least 10 years of age?
questions.chart_title: The table summarizes the distribution of age and assigned group for 90 participants in a study.
questions.explanation: Probability of group A given at least 10 years old = (Group A participants aged 10+)/(Total participants aged 10+) = (11+4)/(30+30) = 15/60 = 1/4
